text:
He rang the doorbell a third time, but this time he did it quietly and calmly, without showing any impatience. Later, he remembered that moment clearly; it stuck in his mind forever. He couldnâ€™t understand how he had been so clever because his mind felt foggy, and he was almost unaware of his body. A moment later, he heard the latch being opened.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov, in a moment of cunning despite his clouded mind, recalls the vivid moment when he heard the latch of the old woman's door unfastened.
